record_data.record_narrative_name: Maple Analytics, LLC Application for Market-Based Rate Authorization and Certain Waiver and Blanket Approvals, Granting of Category 1 Status and Expedited Treatment
record_data.record_plain_text: 2 UNITED STATES OF AMERICABEFORE THEFEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION Maple Analytics, LLC ) Docket No. ER10-2541-000 APPLICATION FOR MARKET-BASED RATE AUTHORIZATION AND CERTAIN WAIVERS AND BLANKET APPROVALS , GRANTING OF CATEGORY 1 STATUS AND EXPEDITED TREATMENT Pursuant to Section 205 of the Federal Power Act (FPA) 16 U.S.C. § 824d (2006). , Rules 204 and 205 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC or Commission), 18 C.F.R. §§ 385.204 and 385.205 (2004). and Rule 35.12 of the Commissions regulations, 18 C.F.R. § 35, as amended by Market-Based Rates for Wholesale Sales of Electric Energy, Capacity and Ancillary Services by Public Utilities, Order No. 697, FERC Stats. & Regs. ¶ 31,352 at PP 13-22 (2007)(Order No. 697). Maple Analytics, LLC (Maple) hereby requests that the Commission (i) authorize Maple to engage in the sale of electric energy, capacity and ancillary services at market-based rates; (ii) accept for filing Maples Market-Based Tariff (designated FERC Electric Rate Schedule Volume No. 1 attached hereto as Appendix A) effective on an expedited basis on October 8, 2010 (i.e., 14 days after filing); (iii) grant such waivers and blanket authorizations as reflected herein and as the Commission has granted to other entities with market-based rate authorization, as described further herein; and (iv) designate Maple a Category 1 Seller as defined in 18 C.F.R. §35.36(a) (the Application). In support of this Application, Maple states as follows: CORRESPONDENCE AND COMMUNICATIONS Maple respectfully requests that all correspondence, communications, pleadings, and other documents related to this proceeding should be addressed to the following persons: Jose Arce Elaine M. Walsh Portfolio Manager Kirkland & Ellis LLP Maple Analytics, LLC 655 Fifteenth Street, N.W. 590 Broadway Unit 2 Washington, D.C. 20005 Somerville, MA 02145 (202) 879-5044 (857) 204-4034 (202) 654-9513 (fax) jose.arce@mapleanalytics.com elaine.walsh@kirkland.com DESCRIPTION OF APPLICANT AND AFFILIATES Maple Analytics, LLC Maple is a Massachusetts limited liability company with corporate offices at 590 Broadway Unit 2, Somerville, MA 02145. Maple is owned and managed by Jose Arce, its sole manager. Jose Arce has no other ties to the energy industry in that he does not own or control any other energy assets or investments. Maple proposes to act as a power marketer purchasing electricity, capacity and ancillary services and reselling such products to wholesale customers in certain U.S. power markets. From time to time, Maple may also engage in other, non-jurisdictional activities and the operation of non-jurisdictional assets and other consulting, advisory and related services. Neither Maple nor its Manager owns or controls generation or transmission, or has a franchised service area for the sale of electricity at retail. Maple is not affiliated, either directly or indirectly, with any public utility, any entity that generates electric power or owns or controls facilities for the transmission of electric power, other than interconnection facilities, or any entity that owns or controls facilities for interstate or intrastate natural gas transportation. REQUEST FOR MARKET-BASED RATE AUTHORITY Maple respectfully requests authorization to sell electric energy, capacity and ancillary services pursuant to the attached Rate Schedule. The Commission has set forth the standards under which it will grant authority to sell wholesale power and capacity at market-based rates in Order No. 697. The Commission has granted market-based rates when a seller (and its affiliates) do not have, or have adequately mitigated, horizontal and vertical market power. See, e.g., Order No. 697 at PP 13-22. In Order No. 697, the Commission updated the four-prong analysis it previously used to evaluate requests for market-based rate authority into a two-prong analysis that reviews horizontal market power (i.e., generation market power) and vertical market power (i.e., transmission market power and upstream barriers to entry). Order No. 697 at PP 13, 397. As discussed below, Maple respectfully requests that the Commission authorize Maple to engage in the sale of electric energy, capacity and ancillary services at market-based rates because Maple does not have horizontal and vertical market power as shown by the fact that it does not own or control any electric transmission, generation or other electric utility assets. Maple and its Affiliates Lack Horizontal Market Power The Commission reviews horizontal market power by analyzing the market power of the seller (and any of its affiliates) that own or control generation in the relevant market. Id. at P 232. The horizontal market power analysis examines the balancing authority area that a sellers generation is physically located in through two screens, the wholesale market share analysis and the pivotal supplier analysis (together, the Indicative Screens), each of which serves as a cross-check on the other to determine whether a seller has the ability to exercise horizontal market power. Id. at PP 33-37, 62. Order No. 697 provides that if a seller passes both of the Indicative Screens, there is a rebuttable presumption that it does not possess horizontal market power. Id. at P 62. As discussed below, Maple passes both Indicative Screens because it does not own or control any electric transmission, generation or other electric utility assets and passes the horizontal market power analysis Indicative Screen. Horizontal Market Share Analysis The Horizontal Market Share Analysis considers the percentage of the total uncommitted generation supply in the market that is owned or controlled by the applicant during each of the four seasons of the year. If the applicant has more than a 20 percent market share of the total uncommitted capacity in the market in any season, it is presumed to have market power. Order No. 697 at PP 23. Maple owns or controls zero percent of the supply in the market, therefore it can not have market power and passes the second Indicative Screen. Pivotal Supplier Analysis The Pivotal Supplier Analysis determines whether an applicant owns or controls generation that will be needed to serve load during peak demand conditions. In particular, the screen determines whether the uncommitted capacity owned or controlled by the applicant is larger than the surplus supply (the difference between the total uncommitted supply and the peak demand) in the wholesale market. Again, Maple owns or controls no generation capacity, therefore it can not have market power. Applicant Lacks Vertical Market Power When determining whether to grant market-based rate authorization, the Commission also takes into consideration the transmission market power of an applicant (and its affiliates), as well as their ability to erect barriers to market entry. This application does not present any vertical market power concerns because Maple does not own or control, and is not affiliated with anyone that owns or controls, any electric transmission, generation or other electric utility assets. Other Considerations Maple also does not operate or control resources that could be used to restrict entry into the market by competing suppliers, marketers or brokers. It does not own or control intrastate natural gas transportation; intrastate natural gas storage or distribution facilities; sites for generation capacity development; or sources of coal supplies and the transportation of coal supplies. 8 C.F.R. §35.37(e) (2010). Further, Maple affirms pursuant to Section 35.37(e)(4) of the Commission's regulations that it has not erected barriers to market entry and will not erect such barriers in the future. 18 C.F.R. §35.37(e)(4) (2010). Section 35.41(c) of the Commission's regulations requires that a seller with market based rate authority notify the Commission of whether it engages in the reporting of transactions to publishers of electricity or natural gas price indices. 18 C.F.R. §35.41 (c) (2010). Seller hereby notifies the Commission that it does not and will not engage in reporting of transactions to publishers of electricity or natural gas price indices. REQUEST FOR WAIVERS, AUTHORIZATIONS, AND JURISDICTIONAL DETERMINATIONS Maple respectfully requests that the Commission grant the following authorizations, waivers, and jurisdictional determinations consistent with those granted to other power marketers with market-based rate authority: waiver of the accounting and other requirements of Part 35, Subparts B and C (except for Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16) and Parts 41, 101, and 141 of the Commissions regulations); waiver of approval under Part 34 of all future issuances of securities and assumptions of liability; and other waivers customarily granted to similarly situated entities. REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED ACTION AND WAIVER OF NOTICE REQUIREMENT Maple respectfully requests that the Commission expeditiously consider this Application and make this Rate Schedule effective on an expedited basis on the earlier of (i) on or before fourteen (14) days following submission of this Application, which is on or before October 8, 2010 or (ii) upon the date that the Commission issues an order in the instant proceeding. Maple seeks to begin participating in auctions and making wholesale sales at market-based rates beginning in mid-October 2010. Such expedited consideration of this Application will allow Maple to commence operations as scheduled and become a participant in the wholesale energy markets. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS Maple agrees to comply with the reporting requirements normally imposed on sellers that are authorized to sell power at market-based rates. Maple will file Electric Quarterly Reports concerning its sales in conformance with the Commissions requirements. In addition, pursuant to the requirements set forth in Section 35.42 of the Commissions regulations, Maple agrees to file timely notices of material changes in status that explain whether such changes reflect a departure from the characteristics relied upon by the Commission in originally granting Maple market-based rate authority. CATEGORY 1 SELLER The Commissions regulations define a Category 1 Seller in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a) as a wholesale power marketer or wholesale power producer that (1) owns or controls 500 MW or less of generation in aggregate per region, (2) does not own, operate or control transmission facilities other than limited interconnection facilities, (3) is not affiliated with anyone that owns, operates or controls transmission facilities in the same region as the seller's generation assets, (4) is not affiliated with a franchised public utility in the same region as the sellers generation assets and (5) does not raise other vertical market power issues. Maple does not own or control any generation or transmission facilities and is not affiliated with any entity that owns, operates or controls transmission facilities in any region; Maple is also not affiliated with a franchised public utility. Accordingly, Maple is a Category 1 Seller as defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a) of the Commission's regulations in all markets and regions regulated by the Commission. ASSET APPENDIX Section 35.37 of the Commissions regulations require market-based rate sellers to include an appendix of jurisdictional assets in the form provided in Appendix B of Order No. 697 when submitting a market power analysis. 18 C.F.R. §35.37 (2010). Appendix B contains only the Rate Schedule as this is the only jurisdictional asset which Maple owns. CONCLUSION WHEREFORE, for the reasons stated above, Maple respectfully requests that the Commission issue an order (i) authorizing Maple to engage in the sale of electric energy, capacity and ancillary services at market-based rates; (ii) accepting for filing Maples FERC Electric Rate Schedule to become effective on October 8, 2010 (i.e., 14 days after filing); (iii) granting such waivers and blanket authorizations as referenced herein and as the Commission has granted to other similar entities with market-based rate authorization; and (iv) designating Maple a Category 1 Seller. Respectfully submitted,MAPLE ANALYTICS, LLCBy: /s/ Elaine M. Walsh Elaine M. WalshKirkland & Ellis LLP655 Fifteenth Street, N.W.Suite 1200Washington, DC 20005Tel: (202) 879-5000Fax: (202) 879-5200elaine.walsh@kirkland.com Counsel forMAPLE ANALYTICS, LLC Dated: September 24, 2010 2 Error! Unknown document property name. Appendix A Maple Analytics, LLC FERC Electric Rate Schedule Volume No. 1 Availability: Maple Analytics, LLC (Seller) makes electric energy, capacity and ancillary services available under this Rate Schedule to any purchaser for resale. Applicability: This Rate Schedule is applicable to all wholesale sales of energy, capacity and/or ancillary services by Seller that are not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule or contract of Seller. Rates: All sales made under this Rate Schedule shall be made at the rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Sellers market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this Rate Schedule or otherwise restricts or limits the Sellers market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Sellers market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Rate Schedule. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: Seller has received (a) waiver of the accounting and reporting requirements contained in 18 C.F.R. Parts 41, 101 and 141; (b) waiver of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subparts B and C, except for sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16; and (c) blanket authorization for the issuance of securities and the assumption of liabilities. See Letter Order, Maple Analytics, LLC, Docket No. ER10-2541-000 (2010). Seller Category: Seller is a Category 1 Seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a). Ancillary Services: PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (PJM) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. New York: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. New England: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England Inc. California: Seller offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation (CAISO) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO. Midwest ISO: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midwest Independent Transmission System Operator, Inc. (Midwest ISO) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to Midwest ISO. Ancillary Services - Third Party Provider: Third-party ancillary services: Seller offers include all of the following that the seller is offering: Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers. Effective Date: This Rate Schedule is effective as of the date specified by the Commission. APPENDIX B Market-Based Rate Authority and Generation Assets Filing Entity and its Energy Affiliates Docket No. where MBR authority was granted Generation Name Owned By Controlled By Date Control Transferred Location In-service Date Nameplate and/or Seasonal Rating Balancing Authority Area Geographic Region (per Appendix D) Maple Analytics, LLC ER10-2451 N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A Electric Transmission Assets and/or Natural Gas Intrastate Pipelines and/or Gas Storage Facilities Filing Entity and its Energy Affiliates Asset Name and Use Owned By Controlled By Date Control Transferred Location In-service Date Size Balancing Authority Area Geographic Region (per Appendix D) Maple Analytics, LLC N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A
